type.name: section
type.title: Short title
type.context: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT under Short title 1. This Act may be cited as the Caribbean Community Special Visa Agreement Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Caribbean Community Special Visa Agreement Act.

act: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT under Interpretation. 2.  In this Act   "Agreement" means the Caribbean Community Special Visa set out in the  schedule which came into force on 12th  December, 2006;  "Minister" means the Minister with responsibility for immigration;   "States Parties" means the States Parties to the Agreement;  LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 18:11 Caribbean Community  Special Visa Agreement   L.R.O. 1/ 2012 have force of      Implemen- tation of amendments to the agreement.   Schedule.           s. 2, 4             Guyana.

act: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Implementation of amendments to the Agreement.  SCHEDULE - Caribbean Community Special Visa Agreement  __________________________  8 of 2007 An Act to provide for the implementation in Guyana of the Caribbean Community Special Visa Agreement and for matters connected therewith.  [31ST JANUARY, 2007]  Short title.     Interpretation.    Schedule
type.context: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT under Implementation of amendments to the Agreement.  SCHEDULE - Caribbean Community Special Visa Agreement  __________________________  8 of 2007 An Act to provide for the implementation in Guyana of the Caribbean Community Special Visa Agreement and for matters connected therewith.  [31ST JANUARY, 2007]  Short title.     Interpretation.    Schedule             4.  (1) Where an amendment to the Agreement is accepted by the States Parties, the Minister may by Order amend the Schedule for the purpose of including the amendments.  (2) Where the Schedule is amended in accordance with this section, any  reference to the Agreement in this Act or any other enactment or any law having effect under any such enactment shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed as a reference to the Agreement so amended.   _________________  SCHEDULE  CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT  Arrangement of Articles

description.description: Where an amendment to the Agreement is accepted by the States Parties, the Minister may by Order amend the Schedule for the purpose of including the amendments.

Where the Schedule is amended in accordance with this section, any  reference to the Agreement in this Act or any other enactment or any law having effect under any such enactment shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed as a reference to the Agreement so amended.   _________________  SCHEDULE  CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT  Arrangement of Articles

act: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT

type.name: section
type.title: CARICOM SPECIAL VISA ISSUED TO SEAMEN
type.context: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT under CARICOM SPECIAL VISA ISSUED TO SEAMEN 5. For practical purposes where a CARICOM Special Visa has been revoked or cancelled pursuant to this article, a stamp may be affixed to the CARICOM Special Visa that clearly shows that it has been revoked or cancelled.   Article 14  EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION AND STATISTICS ON ISSUED CARICOM SPECIAL VISAS
type.description: For practical purposes where a CARICOM Special Visa has been revoked or cancelled pursuant to this article, a stamp may be affixed to the CARICOM Special Visa that clearly shows that it has been revoked or cancelled.   Article 14  EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION AND STATISTICS ON ISSUED CARICOM SPECIAL VISAS

act: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT

type.name: section
type.title: EXTENSION  Appendix 1   Appendix 2      CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT   PREAMBLE  The States Parties  ANTICIPATING that the threat of drug trafficking, terrorism and trafficking in humans is likely to be associated with the large number of persons who are or will be visiting the Community during the hosting of certain events including the ICC Cricket World Cup West Indies 2007 by some States Parties.  DESIRING to make changes to existing national visa arrangements to greatly enhance the measures being taken to reduce the risks associated with these threats.  RECOGNIZING THAT it is in their interest to harmonize by consent their procedures for issuing visas as part of their common policy on the free movement of persons and in order to prevent the same person from lodging multiple visa LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 18:11 Caribbean Community  Special Visa Agreement   L.R.O. 1/ 2012 applications.  DESIRING ALSO to strengthen consular cooperation for the purpose of combating illegal networks.  CONSCIOUS of the need to keep to a minimum the time spent in addressing formalities required for the issue of a visa for entry in the States Parties.  HAVING DECIDED to temporarily suspend the requirements for individual visa for entry into the territory of each of the States Parties by national citizens or subjects of certain foreign States.  RECOGNISING ALSO that under the existing law no authority exists for a State Party to issue a visa which is acceptable in another State Party.  HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS  Article 1  INTERPRETATION  In this Agreement unless the context otherwise determines:-  "alien" means a national citizen or subject of a foreign State.  "CARICOM Special Visa" means the CARICOM Special Visa issued pursuant to this Agreement.  "child" means a person less than 18 years of age.  "Community" means the Caribbean Community including the CARICOM Single Market and Economy (CSME) established by the Revised Treaty of Chaguaramas signed at Nassau, The Bahamas on 5th July,
type.context: CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT ACT under EXTENSION  Appendix 1   Appendix 2      CARIBBEAN COMMUNITY SPECIAL VISA AGREEMENT   PREAMBLE  The States Parties  ANTICIPATING that the threat of drug trafficking, terrorism and trafficking in humans is likely to be associated with the large number of persons who are or will be visiting the Community during the hosting of certain events including the ICC Cricket World Cup West Indies 2007 by some States Parties.  DESIRING to make changes to existing national visa arrangements to greatly enhance the measures being taken to reduce the risks associated with these threats.  RECOGNIZING THAT it is in their interest to harmonize by consent their procedures for issuing visas as part of their common policy on the free movement of persons and in order to prevent the same person from lodging multiple visa LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 18:11 Caribbean Community  Special Visa Agreement   L.R.O. 1/ 2012 applications.  DESIRING ALSO to strengthen consular cooperation for the purpose of combating illegal networks.  CONSCIOUS of the need to keep to a minimum the time spent in addressing formalities required for the issue of a visa for entry in the States Parties.  HAVING DECIDED to temporarily suspend the requirements for individual visa for entry into the territory of each of the States Parties by national citizens or subjects of certain foreign States.  RECOGNISING ALSO that under the existing law no authority exists for a State Party to issue a visa which is acceptable in another State Party.  HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS  Article 1  INTERPRETATION  In this Agreement unless the context otherwise determines:-  "alien" means a national citizen or subject of a foreign State.  "CARICOM Special Visa" means the CARICOM Special Visa issued pursuant to this Agreement.  "child" means a person less than 18 years of age.  "Community" means the Caribbean Community including the CARICOM Single Market and Economy (CSME) established by the Revised Treaty of Chaguaramas signed at Nassau, The Bahamas on 5th July, 21.
